attributes.action: Officially close pubs, clubs, and other hospitality venues during COVID-19
attributes.additional_details: The PM has advised the public to avoid these venues, but not made it an official closure under government powers.  This means that these businesses/individuals would either have to lose money opening to a lack of consumers, or close under circumstances that would forfeit an insurance claim.  Officially closing them means they can claim on the insurance, giving them a lifeline to continue at this difficult time.  Without these claims, the whole industry will suffer a crippling blow.
attributes.background: Officially enforce the closure all pubs, clubs, and other hospitality venues during the COVID-19 crisis, rather than purely just advise it, so that these venues can officially claim the insurance that can be necessary for them to survive this situation.

rejection.details:
Since this petition was started, the Government has announced further measures, including the closure of bars and restaurants. You can read more about this here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-announces-further-measures-on-social-distancing

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
